title: Civil War Defenses of Washington: Park Home
body: Featured Fort of the Month  On forested hills surrounding the nation's capital are the remnants of a complex system of Civil War fortifications. Built by Union forces, these strategic buttresses transformed the young capital into one of the world's most fortified cities. This month CWDW will talk about Battery Kemble. Read More               Civil War Defense Forts    Today nineteen fort sites are administered by the National Park Service located on approximately 130 acres.        Anniversary of the Battle   Join the annual commemoration of the Battle of Fort Stevens and enjoy living history, music, lectures, and more!        2016 Fort Dupont Community Garden   Information about the 2016 Fort Dupont Community Gardens and how to get involved!
